org.jtrim.concurrent

Class ContextAwareWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.concurrent.ContextAwareWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContextAwareTaskExecutor, TaskExecutor

    public final class ContextAwareWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
implements ContextAwareTaskExecutor
    A TaskExecutor implementation forwarding tasks to another task executor an being able to determine if tasks submitted to the ContextAwareWrapper run in the the context of the same ContextAwareWrapper.

    It is also possible to create a task executor which shares execution context with the ContextAwareWrapper via the sameContextExecutor method.

    This class may only be instantiated by the static factory methods in TaskExecutors: TaskExecutors.contextAware and TaskExecutors.contextAwareIfNecessary.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class are safely accessible from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Method of this class are not synchronization transparent unless otherwise noted.
    See Also:
    TaskExecutors.contextAware(TaskExecutor), TaskExecutors.contextAwareIfNecessary(TaskExecutor)

      boolean isExecutingInThis()
      Returns true if the calling code is executing in the context of this executor.
      ContextAwareWrapper sameContextExecutor(TaskExecutor executor)
      Returns an executor which submits tasks to the given executor and executes tasks in the same context as this executor.

    • Method Detail

      • sameContextExecutor

        public ContextAwareWrapper sameContextExecutor(TaskExecutor executor)
        Returns an executor which submits tasks to the given executor and executes tasks in the same context as this executor. That is, calling the isExecutingInThis method of the returned executor is equivalent to calling the isExecutingInThis of this executor.

        Note that this method may or may not return a new instance.

        Parameters:
        executor - the specified executor to which the returned executor will submit tasks to. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        an executor which submits tasks to the given executor and executes tasks in the same context as this executor. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified executor is null

      • isExecutingInThis

        public boolean isExecutingInThis()
        Returns true if the calling code is executing in the context of this executor. That is, it is executed by a task submitted to this executor.

        This method can be used to check that a method call is executing in the context it was designed for.

        This method is synchronization transparent.

        Specified by:
        isExecutingInThis in interface ContextAwareTaskExecutor
        Returns:
        true if the calling code is executing in the context of this executor, false otherwise

      • execute

        public void execute(CancellationToken cancelToken,
           CancelableTask task,
           CleanupTask cleanupTask)
        Executes the task at some time in the future and when the task terminates due to any reason, it executes the specified cleanup task. When and on what thread, the task is to be executed is completely implementation dependent. Implementations may choose to execute tasks later on a separate thread or synchronously in the calling thread at the discretion of the implementation.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface TaskExecutor
        Parameters:
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken which is to be checked if the submitted task is to be canceled. If this CancellationToken signals a cancellation request, this TaskExecutor may choose to not even attempt to execute the submitted task. In any case, the cleanupTask will be executed. This argument may not be null. When the task cannot be canceled, use the static Cancellation.UNCANCELABLE_TOKEN for this argument (even in this case, the TaskExecutor may be able to cancel the task, if it was not submitted for execution).
        task - the task to be executed by this TaskExecutor. This argument cannot be null.
        cleanupTask - the task to be executed after the submitted task has terminated or null if no task is needed to be executed. This cleanup task is executed always and only after the submitted task terminates or will never be executed (due to cancellation). This cleanup task is to be executed in the same context as the submitted task (or if the associated task has been canceled: in the same context where the associated task might have been executed).
        See Also:
        Cancellation.createCancellationSource(), Cancellation.UNCANCELABLE_TOKEN
